evs.utilities.progress
Class ProgressMonitor

java.lang.Object
  evs.utilities.progress.ProgressMonitor
All Implemented Interfaces:
ProgressMonitorInterface
public class ProgressMonitor
extends java.lang.Object
implements ProgressMonitorInterface

Monitors the progress of a long running operation.

Author:
evs@hydrosolved.com

Constructor Summary
ProgressMonitor()
           
 
Method Summary
 void display(java.lang.String start, int displayInterval)
          Displays information about progress on standard out.
 double getIncrement()
          Returns the factor by which progress is incremented when calling increment()()
 int getProgress()
          Returns the state of completion for the monitored operation.
 void increment()
          Increments the progress by the factor currently set.
 boolean isStopped()
          Returns true of the process associated with the monitor has been asked to stop, false otherwise.
 void reset()
          Resets the progress monitor to its default status on construction.
 void setIncrement(double factor)
          Sets the non-negative factor by which to increment the progress when calling increment()()
 void setProgress(int progress)
          Sets the progress to the specified amount.
 void stop()
          Sets the process associated with the monitor to "stopped".

display

public void display(java.lang.String start,
                    int displayInterval)
Displays information about progress on standard out. Specify the start of the message to be displayed when each interval is reached on calling increment()()

Parameters:
start - the start of the message
displayInterval - the display interval

reset

public void reset()
Resets the progress monitor to its default status on construction.

stop

public void stop()
Sets the process associated with the monitor to "stopped". After calling this method isStopped()() will always return true.
